author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body: Hello, for a bit of background, here is the temporary homepage of the Microgrids.X project which includes the present Microgrids.jl package I would like to register: https://pierreh.eu/Microgrids-X/

Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- There is no compat entry for `julia`.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

OK perhaps I didn't follow the good workflow, because I started this first registration PR through juliahub.com web interface. And then, to "retrigger Registrator", I created an issue on my repo (https://github.com/Microgrids-X/Microgrids.jl/issues/2). This has created a new PR https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/71214, so I guess this one should be closed, correct?

As a side note, for a first time user of the General registry, the instruction "simple retrigger Registrator" is not that simple to follow...

> As a side note, for a first time user of the General registry, the instruction "simple retrigger Registrator" is not that simple to follow...

You can clarify them if you want. It just means that you should do exactly what you did the first time to trigger it.

Thanks for closing the PR.

About how to retrigger:

> It just means that you should do exactly what you did the first time to trigger it.

Yes I had found this advice in [README.md §How do I retrigger Registrator...](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md#how-do-i-retrigger-registrator-in-order-to-update-my-pull-request). However, I see two subcases:

- if first trigger is done using a comment `@JuliaRegistrator register` in a PR, like I did the second time ([Microgrids-X/Microgrids.jl#2](https://github.com/Microgrids-X/Microgrids.jl/issues/2) → which created PR  [#71214,](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/71214)), then I see how to retrigger: it's indeed "simply" about adding a new comment `@JuliaRegistrator register`.
- However, using juliahub.com web interface for the first trigger, I didn't find a "retrigger" interface. The only form I could find was to start a *new registration* PR
  - Or is it the case that filling the new package registration form a second time in fact just makes a retrigger on the first PR?

body:

title: New package: Microgrids v0.9.0
